com.javagameengine

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.javagameengine.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    TestGame

    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the basic implementation of a game in the engine. It provides the basic functionality of the game and handles the main game loop. Games built off the engine must include a class that extends this class. To run the game, the method "run()" is called, which initializes the game engine state and structure.

    The AbstractGame class also includes a number of abstract methods which are called at particular points in initialization and the game loop itself. These methods are used by classes that extend AbstractGame to set up game-specific data during start-up and the loop.

      • getHandle

        public static Game getHandle()
        Obtains the Game instance that is currently running.
        Returns:
        Null if game is not running, otherwise current game

      • getActiveScene

      • pause

        public void pause(boolean state)
        Pauses the game. Setting pause to true stops loop from calling update() on scene.
        Parameters:
        state - True to pause the game

      • run

        public void run(java.lang.String[] args)
         throws org.lwjgl.LWJGLException
        Runs the game. Initializes the game engine and starts the main loop.
        Parameters:
        args - Arguments applied to game on startup
        Throws:
        GameInitializationException
        org.lwjgl.LWJGLException

        Parameters:

        Returns:
